intro: Microstylis seychellarum, commonly known as the Seychelles microstylis, is a small herbaceous plant native to the Seychelles archipelago. It belongs to the family Poaceae, commonly known as the grass family, and is characterized by its slender, tufted growth habit. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically clustered at the base of the leaf blades. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in coastal or wetland habitats. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
